reviewText: Ratt have found a new way to pollute the world and thats a video collection! Relive the memories of cheese and bad haircuts and guys in girl makeup.It does crack me up Stephen Pearcy has failed to release a live album since he can't hold a note to save his life.If you want to cure insomnia, I"m afraid this will give you nightmares. A great christmas grab bag gift for the ones you hate!

Title: N/A

reviewText: As with "Dokken's "Unchain the Night", this "Ratt" Videos from the Cellar" is just as good with videos from the same time, some of the videos are sexually suggestive, but hey, this was the 80's where rock bands ruled the charts & MTV & pretty much has held up in terms of artistic quality, can anyone compare this music to today's so-called music, not that today's music is all bad, but in terms of artistic quality, few can do that today, we also get interviews with the band members who seem laid back for the most part, even Little Richard pops in to chat with them, he obviously was a fan no doubt, the only disappointment here is the video "Nobody Rides for free" is MIA, this is a song they did for the 1991 film "Point Break" that starred Patrick Swayze & Keanu Reeves & there are highlights of the film in the video, which is likely the reason why it is missing because of copyright issues, however, aside from this, all their other great ones are here, A must own for "Ratt" fans!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow, this DVD release is special. It collects 2 old Ratt VHS video releases, and adds on about 4 more videos. It was a treat watching this as all the songs are great, and the videos are good, especially the earlier videos which feature cameos from Ozzy Osbourne and Motley Crue. The Detonator video all videos are well made, the band looks great and the production is professional.  Also all the girls featured in the videos are amazing.  Plus good to see Robin Crosby again, his guitar playing with Ratt should not be forgotten about.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It is what it is and its Ratt.  You get their good videos, cheesiest outfits and above avg songs.  I like it though because it brings back awesome memories of what the 80's were.  Ratt was a top notch live act and jammed.They still tour to this day and I can't wait to see them.

reviewText: I love Ratt.  Give me a nice live show to check out.  Nothing earth shattering here.  If you need to replace your VHS versions, cool.  Nicely put together.

reviewText: This was a lot of fun to watch. I never owned or even knew about the VHS equivalents of these so this was news to me. Most of these I hadn't even seen. It was such a blast from the past, well worth the $.

reviewText: I've been a RATT fan since '84. They wrote some of the best material to come out of the 1980's. This collection of videos by the band is very good with excellent picture and sound quality. I purchased it used through Amazon's market sellars so my investment was minimal. The price was right and I recommend this for any fan of the band.....
